html: Dumah—Of Edom or Idumea. He—The people of Dumah, one of them in the name and by the appointment of the rest. Me—To the watchman: the prophet delivers his prophecy in the form of a dialogue between the people and the watchman. Seir—Out of Edom, which is frequently called Seir. Watchman—The watchman of Edom, whom they had set as people use to do in times of great danger. Night—The people are supposed to come to him very early in the morning, to enquire what had happened in the night; which shews a state of great perplexity and fear. Night—The repetition of the words, shew the greatness of their solicitude.
